subject: Leadership
title: The Role of Vision in Strategy
description: A quick, practical guide to The Role of Vision in Strategy.

hook.text: In 1961, Kennedy declared America would reach the moon by decade's end. NASA had no idea how. Vision pulled them.

buildup.text: Vision is a vivid picture of a desired future. It gives strategy its destination and teams their motivation.

discovery.text: Collins and Porras found that visionary companies outperform markets by 15x over decades. Vision is a competitive edge.

twist.text: A vision nobody understands is useless. The best visions are simple, memorable, and emotionally compelling.

climax.text: Leaders translate vision into strategy by asking: where are we going, why does it matter, and how will we get there?

punchline.text: Vision without strategy is a dream. Strategy without vision is a grind.

quiz.question: Why is vision essential to strategy?
options: It replaces the need for planning
